intro: Euryptera hassei, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Euryptera hassei is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers.
